result.execSummary:
The defendant Danica Joy Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 represents buy money owed to the Wisconsin Central Drug Task Force.  Defendant to set up payment plan within ninety (90) days with Probation Agent.  $500 represents DNA surcharge ($250 surcharge per count).  Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol.    Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.    Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.    Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Not to associate with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs.    No contact with:  Melanie Ganje, Christopher Sperry, Allison Fedie, Shawn Dwyer, Kyrie Tetzloff, Lang Thao or Pa Houa Xiong.    No contact with: the victims, Heather Felch, or Eau Claire Travel Center.
Pursuant to a Hearing on February 6, 2015, Defendant is allowed contact with Mary Begley.
Submit a DNA sample.  Defendant to maintain full time employment, school; or both.

timeConds.notes: Huber for work release.  89 days credit.  If after serving four (4) months jail and Defendant is in compliance with the terms of her Probation, the remaining four (4) months jail will be stayed pending successful completion of Probation.
